Reviews.Title: “Lovely Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CristiKant
Reviews.Content: In the vibrant heart of SIngapore, positioned in a very quite and erstored street. Berjara is a pretty Boutique Hotel with decoration recalling Colonial residences. My room was decent and clean, nothing very fancy but OK for a short stay, even if the wIndow of my room was too small and it was a very dark room. Front Desk was very friendly and helpful. Bathroom amenities and breakfast need some improvements - I have found them both very poor.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Old Hotel... but run down”
Reviews.Author: TRB
Reviews.Content: THE GOOD: Our room was big and comfortable. The location was convenient to Chinatown and fairly convenient to the MRT transit system. The lobby was beautiful. The staff was friendly and helpful. There was a free english language newspaper delivered to our door every morning. The room was serviced twice daily and kept exceptionally clean. THE BAD: The room was expensive and they add a 10% service charge which probably doesn't go to the person who cares for your room. Wi-Fi was $8/hour or $35/day extra! Breakfasts were $18.00. A liter of water is $10.00! The dining room was closed for dinner. The wooden furniture in our room was old and beat up. There were several clubs and bars directly across the street that were very noisy. The windows had an extra layer of plastic glued over the glass in an attempt to cut down the noise from the bars and clubs across the street. The plastic was old and difficult to see through. There was a comfortable love seat and chair, but no reading lamp. You had to move the lamp from the desk back and forth between the seating area and the desk. In summary this was a great hotel 20 years ago, and could be again someday.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Malcolm R
Reviews.Content: This hotel although a little basic was very nice. The staff were excellent and very friendly. Close to China Town and easy to get to the city centre with two MRT stations within a 10 minute walk

Reviews.Title: “Never going back! Exterior of hotel doesnt match interior of rooms”
Reviews.Author: anontraveller_12
Reviews.Content: I dont understand why this hotel has so many 'very good' reviews. I regretted staying in this hotel. My bf booked it for us for one night as a staycation. And it was horrid! Yes, I admit, we were rather impressed with the exterior of the hotel. The lobby was absolutely exquisite and even the walkways to the room were very colonial-like. However, the rooms were nothing colonial. Just old, and musty smelling. We asked the reception if we could upgrade to a bigger room, or even the suite, but he was rather offhandish, and said that they had a 98% occupancy rate. We also requested for wi-fi and were told we had to pay. Seriously? For the rates we pay for this hotel, you ask us to pay for the wi-fi? Ridiculous. The toilet seat was broken too. The room is big, but the cupboards and arrangement of the bed makes it very constrained. At the end, they also claimed that one towel was missing, and made us pay for it. I have NEVER encountered such a thing before. what a disappointment. there are so many better boutique hotels that provide more value for money. Firstly, you have to pay for the hotel wi-fi.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel on quiet area”
Reviews.Author: KURIPOT45
Reviews.Content: Stayed here several times before. Breakfasts are not as good as in thr past but it will still be my first choice due to the old colonial feeling and it had a charm that many hotels lack. Across the road the Flying Hog bar has got really caring staff and is an escape from the bustle of the city. Prices are reasonable and hotel guests get a discount on the bill which is a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “good for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: simone_a13
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights in early March - was happy with the room - clean, quiet. I specifically asked for a room away from the street and though it had one window that looked out onto the rest of the building, I was really only at the hotel to sleep so it didn't bother me. I think this is the trick as there was no street noise. Only minor issue with the room was a bit of mould around some of the older cornices in the bathroom - it's the sort that seems like it's settled into the paint. The hotel is in a converted old shop house row near Chinatown - quaint area with a lot of character. The nearest MRT is about 10 minutes walk away, but it's reasonably flat so not too much of an issue with a suitcase (mine has wheels). Staff are friendly and helpful, and they stored my luggage after checkout for the entire day, as I wasn't flying out until the evening.

Reviews.Title: “lovely singapore stay”
Reviews.Author: i_gtg
Reviews.Content: upon walking up to the hotel, i immediately knew we found a gem of a hotel. it was in a great location in Tanjong Pagar, just a few minutes away from Tanjong Pagar MRT and Chinatown. the hotel itself seemed very regal, yet the service from the staff was friendly and warm. our room, though small for what i expected, had everything we wanted and needed--a TV, coffee/tea set, toiletries, safe, bathrobes, complimentary bottled water. the staff were always nice and accommodating, helping us to get taxis when we had to rush to a friend's wedding reception or to the airport. while we hardly spent time inside the hotel, the little time we were there went smoothly. only thing i'd like next time? breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Spot on for what we needed!!”
Reviews.Author: Aeparker81
Reviews.Content: Good price, just on edge of Chinatown, friendly staff - exactly what was needed for this part of our trip

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly recommended”
Reviews.Author: jaydownes
Reviews.Content: Small, pretty hotel in China town surrounded by lovely colonial buildings. The room was a little small and the decor rather tired but spotlessly clean and the public areas of the hotel are charming. The excellent customer service received and the lovely staff were truly outstanding. Breakfast was average but perfectly acceptable. The hotel is easily accessible by the SMRT and within 5 minutes walk of China Town's shops and restaurants. This hotel is thoroughly recommended for visitors to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Berjaya”
Reviews.Author: KURIPOT45
Reviews.Content: I first used this hotel a couple of years ago and will be making a return visit later in the month. I like the location and the colonial feel of the hotel. There is a 7-11 directly across the road from the hotel and a handy little bar The Flying Hog which has a relaxed atmosphere also located across the street. Breakfasts were excellent on my last visit.

Reviews.Title: “second visit”
Reviews.Author: marieanddon
Reviews.Content: stayed for 2 nights and was very nice. clean good air conditoning. room big and beds comfortable. Easy to get to on SMRT, near china town. Definitely would stay again as rates good and breakfast good

Reviews.Title: “Location”
Reviews.Author: Sunshinegirl044
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is on the edge of Chinatown and this is where I found the best places for bargains and eating local food. The hotel is well maintained and it reminds me of Raffles style, old British with soft music playing. I read some previous reviews and asked for a room at the back of the hotel as these are quiet. I was not disappointed, the staff were helpful and the breakfast kept me going for the day. There is nothing to fault with this hotel for a stopover to see Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “its ok for a stay over”
Reviews.Author: vj1
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this hotel in may 20112 on a one night stop over on the way back from thailand. The hotel is clean and peaceful and the rooms are standard. It is near to China Town but is a long way out from the river area and unless you book a taxi from the hotel they are very hard to flag down. I do not know if this is normal practice but it resulted in a lot of walking. The breakfast in the hotel is averaage and if you have booked bed & breakfast you have the choice of a set. Be warned that any extra requirements are chargeable and it isnt cheap. We went on a river cruise during the day which was lovely and well worth it. in the evening we ate at one of the river side restaurants. The food was average and not a patch on the delights in thailand. we had 2 drinks each (2 wines and 2 beers) and a main course each and this cost approx £80. A small bottle of heineken cost £4. We flew with Singapore airways and the service is impeccable the flight crew were fantastic and did not stop with drinks etc the whole flight. Well done Singapore Airline! All in all the time at the Berjaya was ok but we wont be rushing back

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but small and old...”
Reviews.Author: AnneHastie
Reviews.Content: the hotel is really good in terms of location. However, do not ask for more apart from a clean room everything else is old. Service is good as well. Free internet in the lobby. Don't expect too much from the restaurant. The hotel is just right in front of a 7-11 store and a long stretch of night clubs and karaoke bars. It is located 15 minutes walk from the nearest train station.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely old hotel in great location near Chinatown”
Reviews.Author: Kim H
Reviews.Content: We loved this charming old hotel, the furniture, the stunning old prints lining the corridors, and the paper delivered to our door each morning. We had requested and were given a quiet room, so no problem with noise. The room was fine, comfortable bed, spacious enough and any problems (e.g. desk light not working) were attended to promptly. We also loved the area, the old buildings and proximity to a food court and train stations. We stayed 5 nights booked through our holiday club, may have been a bit pricey otherwise. Staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Decent location but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: stoeff99
Reviews.Content: I booked the Berjaya as part of a business trip. After changing my room, because the room I booked was no larger than a cupboard, I couldn’t complain. The hotel is in a nice old building. Similar to staying in a pub in England. The shower however does have mouldy spots. So nothing for picky people. The surprise came, when I informed the reception that I needed to check out earlier than expected. They forced me to pay a night stay as penalty. At 260 SGD a night, that’s quite a fine... Concluding: A decent hotel, but not ideal if you need to be flexible with your booking.

Reviews.Title: “Simple and nice hotel. Nearby to Chinatown.”
Reviews.Author: AhKing
Reviews.Content: Small, simple and cozy hotel. Located at commercial area. You need a map or GPS to locate the hotel when u drive. Otherwise, take a cab. Lots of pub & bistro nearby. 10-minutes walk to Chinatown. There's a convenience store across the street. A safe place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “A touch of the old Singapore”
Reviews.Author: hotelreview2932
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed 3 nights in deluxe room 406 on a business trip to the lion city. Seems this part of the hotel is of a lower standard, cleanliness and freshness, a big indent and cracks in the wall close to the bed, dirty and misscolored around AC intakes/out and the performance of the AC is very poor. Room and bathroom is of good size. Front desk staff is very helpfull and friendly, the breakfast is limited but of good quality, the friendly breakfast staff would look so much better in a proper uniform, instead of sneakers, black jeans and T-shirt, my first breakfast i took them for guests in the hotel until asked for room number and egg selection. The hotel has a great potential, beautiful old building and great location, its pitty the management isnt caring about the details.

Reviews.Title: “Convenience and Reasonably Priced”
Reviews.Author: Mitselakis
Reviews.Content: I asked for an early check-in as I was arriving from Heathrow at 7am! It sorted of happened in the end after a wait of three hours, during which they offered me a cup of coffee, which they charged me for!! The room was worth waiting for, on the top floor at the back...Huge bathroom....Freezing cold though because the air con was on high so we soon turned that off! A slight battle with the housekeeping staff who kept turning it on and I kept turning it off. The bed was so comfortable that I passed out straight away and missed my afternoon 'tea cruise', but the staff were very helpful making phone calls to book me another one. The main thing about this hotel apart from the comfort and the old fashioned touches like turning the bed down and providing a free newspaper, is the location. Right next door to Chinatown where there are some great places to eat and go shopping, the MRT is a few minutes walk away but it is a bit of a stroll to the middle of the city i.e. Boat Quay, Beware the Internet charges, you buy a voucher for an hour but you have to use it all in one go or you lose the rest of the time! I was lucky as I found that by standing by the window I could pick up someone else's WiFi for free, not only that in the street behind is The Uluru Steakhouse that has free internet, ask for the code when you buy a glass of wine and then use their connection for the rest of your stay as the signal reaches the hotel, at least the rooms at the back. As hotels in Singapore go it is very reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Old and coming of age”
Reviews.Author: OneSingleTrip
Reviews.Content: Located in the heart of Chinatown has a very good location as all the eateries and the key attractions points of the Chinatown are all walking distance. The China Night market and the temples are all close by. The hotel though has good decor but the furniture in the rooms have outlived their usage. Though the hotel is nice and comfortable and the management has tried thier best to keep intact the heritage look, it comes out just passable in the end. We stayed 3 nights and overall was a avergae to good stay. The hotel staff is courteous and very helpful. The food in the hotel is not something to greatly remember but the street lanes around the hotel are full of some very good pubs and restaurants and that make this location an even better place to stay if that is something one is looking for as a pastime. The hotel is nearly eaquidistant from the Outram Park and Chinatown station by walk. The Outram Park station is preferred as its the junction point for the purple and the green line trains. A taxi would be preferable if with kids if going to outram park station. Its okay for a short stay but needs a little deeper thought if one want to stay longer.

Reviews.Title: “colonial shophouse”
Reviews.Author: pobol
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights on a stopover and the hotel had been recommended by our travel agent on the basis of it gving us a more 'authentic' experinece of Singapore in a colonial style of hotel; it turned out we had been booked into one of the cheaper rooms. The first room shown was not suitable - small, shabby, at the back looking at alleyway. We were then shown another room which we stayed in and was a bit better, but (similar comments to some of the reviews already written) - aircon noisy, still small, needed a makeover, one side looking at lift shaft. I was ready to check out the next morning but my husband thought we should have another word with reception, and so we were shown a room at the front for which we paid extra to upgrade - far bigger, all much, much better. There was some noise from the street, which the manager pointed out, but with the aircon on you couldn't really hear it, it was ok. The staff were extremely polite and helpful at all times. We really enjoyed the location, in Chinatown, busy, lots of bars, places to eat, (e.g. it's very near Maxwell Rd centre) and truly atmospheric, some lovely architecture and fascinating culture-wise, not completely taken over by tourist stuff. So all in all we had a great time and were glad that we had stayed there after all.....just think carefully about what kind of hotel suits you, think in terms of character, i.e. not quite shabby chic, and make sure you check what sort of room you have booked.

Reviews.Title: “think carefully before booking the Berjaya”
Reviews.Author: trudi j
Reviews.Content: Having spent one night at the Berjaya on two stopovers on the way to Australia my advice would be to think carefully about what type of hotel you are looking for. Yes, the location is good, five minutes from Chinatown but the approach to the hotel and the surrounding area is not pleasant and very off putting. The price for a nights accommodation were very reasonable for Singapore but the accommodation was really poor. The first room we were allocated was tiny, dark dreary and very smelly. The air conditioning sounded more like an engine running and in all the room was totally unsuitable. When this was pointed out to the staff we were able to pay £30 for an upgraded room which was marginally better. However the room still had a very unpleasant odour and extremely noisy air conditioning. In both rooms the decor was poor, peeling wallpaper, poor bathrooms etc. On the return stopover we experienced the same problems and really did not enjoy the stay at this hotel at all, it was a relief to leave. I just wish that I had thought to move to another alternative hotel for the second stopover and accept that it would cost more. The staff at the hotel were absolutely charming but that did not make up for the extremely poor state of the bedrooms.

Reviews.Title: “Some good bits, some not so good”
Reviews.Author: bushmammal
Reviews.Content: The public-facing areas seem nicer than the rooms from my experience. There was nothing really wrong with it and for a business trip the hotel was perfectly good. It could have been a bit cleaner, the room was dark and a little bit tired: The chair at the desk was a bit rickety. There's definitely not enough powerpoints in the room either... there was really only one that was usable and thats just not acceptable. The internet was adequate but a ittle unreliable and expensive if its not in the package as mine was. It's also crazy that it needed to be bought on an hourly, daily or weekly basis... againm they need to update their thinking. The public areas as nice, clean and airy. The restaurant is fine although the buffet was a bit limited. All of that said, I was there for work so it was fine... it did the job adequately and I'd be happy to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: aanondo
Reviews.Content: The Berjaya in Singapore is a very comfortable hotel from all aspects. The people are polite and helpful. The breakfast is very nice, 'specially the bacon and sausages'. The Seven Eleven right opposite is a boon, plus the nightlife in the area is good. The food options in the near vicinity are also ok. The hotel is also very well connected via Train, Bus and of course, via taxi . Coming back to the hotel, what you will love is that this is an archeological site and therefore all the items in the hotel are antique. But that does not mean that the amenities in house are anything but antique. The only thing missing is a pool. I would have marked it as a 5 if this place had a pool :)

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: stacego
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideally situated for exploring singapore via the MRT with a station 5 minutes walk away.It was clean and had all amenities that you would need.The staff are very friendly and overall i would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “a big mistake”
Reviews.Author: perthsingapore
Reviews.Content: After much research on this website and others we decided to book a room for 3 nights at this hotel. Although the reviews on this site were mixed, most seemed to be good. As we have been to Singapore many times and stayed in several different hotels in different areas we felt we were well equiped to make a good choice of hotel. This was a big mistake. After booking the hotel, and at a very good rate I made contact with them regarding our booking and enquired if they could book private hotel transfers for us. They replied that they could, explaining the costs and also offering us alternatives. We decided to ask them to go ahead and make the arrangements for the transfers, to which they emailed that they would do this. On arrival in Singapore there was no one to meet us and after 20 minutes waiting I phoned the hotel and after much confusion by the staff member he eventually said no car had been booked. We caught a taxi, on arrival at the hotel, despite apologising to us for the mixup we were told that the driver was actually there and we didn't see him!!!! However they apologised once again and said that they had upgraded our room. We were shown to a room at the front of the hotel overlooking the street, it was obviously in need of refurbishment with wallpaper peeling off the walls,mouldy tiles over the bath/shower, a noisy airconditioner and dirty carpet, but we weren't really worried about that because of the initial room rate we had paid. Then it got dark and the night clubs and pubs across the street kicked off. That was it, there was no sleep that night for the noise. In the early hours my husband decided to have a shower,that was when we discovered it was near on impossible to stand in the bath to have a shower. Not only was it very narrow, but it was extremely slippery and there was no rubber mat to stand on. And then to make matters even worse the airconditioner decided it was going to switch on and off every 60 seconds ( you tend to count these things as you lay awake in the dark). So even if we did start to fall asleep it would wake us again. At around 4 am I got on the internet to look into other hotels that had availability.At 5.30 I could wait no longer and phoned another hotel to make a reservation,( we were very lucky and got a room at Park Hotel Clarke Quay which I would highly recommend). At around 8 am I informed the reception staff that we would be checking out of the hotel shortly and could they please get our bill ready. They seemed surprised, and when I explained the noise, lack of sleep and inability to use the shower as our reasons they were apologetic. On arrival back in the room I received a phone call offering a further upgrade of rooms as an apology. I declined the offer considering the room we were in was also an upgrade by way of an apology!!! The hotel only charged us for the night that we stayed and the internet usage that we had signed up for. They were quite within their rights to charge us for the following two nights as that was in the agreement when we originally booked. The only conclusion that I can come to regarding this hotel and the mixed reviews is that there must be some very different standards of rooms in this hotel depending on which part of the hotel the room is in. I would not recommend this hotel unless you are planning to spend most of the night in the pubs and clubs opposite and sleep only when they have closed as the hotel is certainly quiet during the day.

Reviews.Title: “Forget about the Berjaya - terrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: fredsmithInJapan
Reviews.Content: I am not sure who can write anything positive about this hotel. Positive reviewers must either be staff/people paid to write positive reviews or guests who have only ever stayed in cheap flea-ridden hotels. The bathroom is moldy, the shower curtain smelly and inadequate to prevent water spray, the toilet an old yellow stained contraption and the towels cheap and scratchy. The floors are dirty. Best to wear your dirty shoes than risk infections from the germs enjoying the cheap carpet. The aircon has a great buzzing sound. Turn it off if you want to sleep, but remember, you are on the Equator and it is very warm, even at night. The bed is ok, but for the bedbugs. If you like bed bugs, then you will really enjoy the bed. The Wifi doesn't work. Don't even think about paying for the wifi service, as you will be lucky to get even a weak connection. The Berjaya is not worthy of anything more than 2 stars. Stay here only if you are poor and want to sleep in a room which is a bit better than a backpackers or youth hostel.

Reviews.Title: “a hotel with a character”
Reviews.Author: elaf
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Berjaya Hotel for 3 nights. The hotel has a lot of character from the outside and inside. It is in good location (Chinatown) and the area is really nice and not too busy. It's about 5-10 min walk from the nearest MRT station (Tajong Pagar). It is just two stations from the Harbourfront Station where you hop onto Sentosa Express to get to Sentosa island. The service really nice and helpful and never had any problems. They order taxis for you and help if you have any questions about the city, how to get to a particular place or which is the best place to shop for electronic gadgets (Funan - it is the cheapest, the same thing at Suntec City was much more expensive). The room itself (standard/studio) wasn't a wow but nice and cosy and clean. It was big enough for us and a baby. They provided a free proper wooden cot with bedding for our baby as well. We had some limited space because of that but it's not like we lived there, we just spent nights there so no problems. The bathroom is very decent with a shower enclosure - big enough for a bath. They provide bath towels and face/hand, complimentary toiletries - shampoo, conditioner, lotion, shower gel, cotton buds. There is also extendable washing line under the shower enclosure. In the room there is a wardrobe with hangers, bedside tables, inroom safe, desk with a chair, flatscreen tv, tea/coffee making facilities, mini bar and a fridge. The only negative thing about the room - not sure if it is the case with other rooms, but this one was damp. There was no mould or anything anywhere, not even in the bathroom but we could feel the dampness in the air when we walked in, and could feel it throughout the whole stay.If we had some wet clothes, they wouldn't get dry and stay damp. Also aircon was a bit noisy butit is just a matter of getting used to it. The wifi connection is just under 26 SGD for 24 hours but we didn't use it so don't know how it works. The taxi from/to the hotel (to/from Changi airport) is just under 18 SGD. The taxis in general are relatively cheap (from Suntec Mall to the hotel we paid just under 6 SGD) but good luck queuing for it especially outside some shopping centres. There is always a taxi queue so no queue jumping. The waiting time can get close to the journey time by MRT so think twice. The Singapore zoo - 30 min by taxi, around 20 SGD. All the rooms at the front of the property are the suites with living room and the spiral staircase leading to the bedroom. There are a few bars opposite so in the evening it might get noisy. The restaurant serves breakfast only, no options of lunch or dinner. The breakfast is really good and you have a choice of continental - muesli or cornflakes - ... served with condensed milk (!!!) - I only tried it once and then stuck to the american option - sausages, beans, eggs, pancake, juice, tea/coffee. In general, nice hotel with nice service and in great location.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful hotel”
Reviews.Author: moggey
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights before a cruise. Small delightful hotel,with character.All mod cons,extremely helpful staff,good breakfast. We asked for 2 beds,and were given a 2 level suite. In a quiet area near china town.Eat at a small cafe nearby. Had a delicious meal on a tour of Raffles Hotel and surrounding area,with Viator tours.

Reviews.Title: “GEM - Value for money in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: AvidTravellers56
Reviews.Content: Since the casino opened in Singapore accommodation rates have sky rocketed. We've been to Singapore approx 8 times in the past 3 years and the Berjaya still is great value for $$$ Yes, internet access in your room is expensive BUT you can use the internet in the foyer for FREE plus it has a printer (very convenient for online check-in and printing of ticket) and most people don't even know it's there. Staff very friendly, and location is great - easy walk to China town which is an experience in itself. Breakfast is standard fare of cereal, toast, bacon and eggs etc. All in all it's great value for money in Singapore these days.

Reviews.Title: “A bit dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: Buick54
Reviews.Content: After spending quite a considerable amount of time researching hotels that suited our purpose we decided on the Berjaya. Arrived too early to check in but that was ok as the reception staff looked after our bags whilst we went exploring. The room on first impressions was that it would be fine. It was a reasonable size and had everything that we required. It was one of the rooms facing the back alley / block of flats and the window glass was opaque ie. non see through. The other window looked down to the glass roof above the lift well, noisy during the rain. We had to have the curtains closed all the time because the rooms above looked down into ours. So with all that and the poor lighting it gave the room a very gloomy feel. But after settling in and spending the first night our thoughts changed. The hotel still accepts guests who persist with the unhealthy habit of smoking. Although we had a non-smoking room the smoke stench from down the corridor wafted down into our room. I'm sure also the air conditioner sucked in smoke from somewhere and we had to sleep the second night with it off ( only stayed two nights thankfully ) ---- and it was very noisy. The bathroom was just ok but the shower cubicle was showing it's age. The bed was firm but not uncomfortable but the pillows were very , very soft. Too soft for us with no neck support. The mini bar fridge was only a cooler and was almost useless for getting anything chilled, no ice making facility. The kettle was a cheap little piece of crap that barely got close to boiling. The hotel is in a good location, the staff were nice but I don't know about the bars / nightclubs across the street how much noise they would make during a busy period. My advice would be to pay a little bit more and get something better eg. Hotel 1929, which is what we should have stuck to in the beginning

Reviews.Title: “Great Botique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DCM1a
Reviews.Content: Arrived on 30 Oct 10 for 3 days. Met by staff with fruit drink whilst cases unloaded and a good value trip arranged at the same time . Room upgraded to mini suite , this was done before trip even mentioned. Great location near Chinatownm and Clarke Quay. Hotel was 3 storey and typical of the colonial type of hotel I recall in the Singapore and Hong Kong of 50 years ago. Last time we stayed in a 5* Hyatt Hotel , very good, but we preferred Berjaya. Only downside is that one evening we were kept awake til 2am with noise emanating from the bar opposite. Despite that would book in there again.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel for your stay”
Reviews.Author: buzzellipaolo
Reviews.Content: We were eager to visit Singapore. One of my friends had been stayed at this hotel and recommended it. So I booked the hotel and stayed there for four days. It's a worthy stay. The room was clean and spacious, fresh air. The bed was also comfortable for our nights. The staff were courteous and helpful. All our needs were met. I'd highly recommend the hotel to you.

Reviews.Title: “A mixed bag, both in terms of location and room quality”
Reviews.Author: zwpor8
Reviews.Content: Location is a mixed bag - 5-10 minute walk to Tanjong Pagar MRT (metro) station, in the Chinatown district which means lots of local hawkers food centres, but the hotel is situated on a road with a row of bars. The area is primarily a night area, so it is quiet during the day but seems a bit sleazy and seedy at night. The deluxe rooms are rather dated in furnishings, but fairly large. A complaint is that there are no free electrical plug points you can use to charge your laptop or mobile phone etc - the only option is to unplug the desk lamp and stand lamp, which makes the room quite dark (the other lighting is inadequate). Internet is not free and somewhat expensive (much cheaper to go to the internet café down the road). Service was again a mixed bag - friendly but inefficient. We had to ask for an iron 3 or 4 times before it was delivered (the first time, we were told the hotel had run out and to try again the next day, which we did, only to have to ask several more times). For those who are driving from Malaysia, the hotel does not have its own sheltered / underground car park, but there is one right next to the hotel. You can buy the prepaid parking coupons from 7-11 opposite the hotel, but bear in mind if you're thinking of driving that parking in Singapore is expensive. Overall, there are probably other hotels in Singapore which would offer a better package / experience.

Reviews.Title: “as expected”
Reviews.Author: chreong
Reviews.Content: The hotel is as expected. However this time around, the internet service is not very efficient. Considering in a location like Singapore, is very surprising! the rest is as expected.

Reviews.Title: “Really impressed”
Reviews.Author: NJS1982
Reviews.Content: I honestly thought this hotel was amazing. We were upgraded for free for one double room with a mezzanine level (we pretended it was our honeymoon!). Very colonial style, friendly staff, excellent room. Recommend to anyone having a stop over.

Reviews.Title: “Colonial Feel”
Reviews.Author: SharinaShah
Reviews.Content: Nice small hotel located near Chinatown. Near MRT station. Quite noisy at night as there were several night spots opposite hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute rip-off! Beware the lack of services/standards behind a charming exterior!”
Reviews.Author: Banpokies1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a sham that is held together by good, loyal and long-suffering staff and not much else. The owners must be dreadful to work for, as the poor staff copped all the flack of complaining guests (I heard 2 others going off as well as myself). Maintenance problems were the biggest issues and "room not as described or imagined" caused guests grief. We stayed for 4 days pre-paid on Wotif...then to find that the rate was higher than advertised at the hotel itself. They used the old "oh that rate includes taxes etc" excuse but that was rubbish! The rates were over $320 AUD per night for a mezzanine room with one double bed and a sofa...that was not advertised as a bed space but nevertheless was broken....so sitting on it meant that the cushions fell into the broken sofa bed mechanism! Windows overlooking the street did not open, but that was OK in one way as the noise from the bars was loud enough! It was a most disappointing experience. It took 3 of our 4 days stay to finally get our cold tap to work in the only sink...upstairs....and the tea/coffee cups/jug etc were all downstairs! PLUS...the only plugs allowed in the bathroom were shaver plugs so we could not take the tea/coffee things up to the bathroom! SO we had to fill the small electric jug from the upstairs bath then carry it down the rickety, spiral staircase to make coffee and drink it!....I finally received a water jug so we could at least have an easy refill on hand...downstairs! Even more, the 2 coffee sachets and whitener, powdered and awful...were not worthy of such a hotel. Fresh milk and more beverages would have been appreciated. The housemaids obviously also hated having no running water downstairs as our dirty coffee cups were left if we had not washed them ourselves. It was too hard to get up to wash them every time. The aircon was terrible. Loud/inefficient....to set the temp upstairs meant that downstairs we froze in a blast of cold air. It was ancient system and made a joke of the 4 star rating etc. People were sitting on the front steps smoking as there was no table/seating outside to smoke even half-way politely. It was a very poor presentation to new guests especially. That also meant that nowhere could we read outside etc. All up I would never go back. Another man I spoke with had booked for a month in a tiny studio room and had been lucky enough to get a larger room for the same money, after he complained. Having paid all in advance we could do nothing...not even leave without loss. My cab fare to the airport was $12 more after the hotel booked it, than when we took the same trip to the hotel, at peak rates...so that also annoyed me as in 'the straw that broke the camel's back'! Avoid this place like the plague....much better value is elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: jmh2010
Reviews.Content: Very happy with this hotel. Can't believe the bad reviews! This hotel offered great location, friendly service, good value for money, beautiful decor- can't ask for more than that!

Reviews.Title: “Seen better days”
Reviews.Author: londonlady91
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in great location but ...... rooms were a bit tired, the bar was never open - my friends were told they could buy drinks at the 7 Eleven over the road and bring them back! I had a room at the front and the noise from the bars was unacceptable in my view even with the a/c on - you should not need ear plugs to get a good nights sleep. Breakfast was good - plenty of choice and all freshly cooked to order but on one day the hotel was full and it seemed a bit chaotic. I'd rather pay more for somewhere better and perhaps with a swimming pool to relax in after a hard days sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: Sondon
Reviews.Content: Hotel service was excellent. Room was okay - a little tired and a wee bit damp smelling but everything clean and a good size. Good location - close to Chinatown and MRT. 7 Eleven just across the road. Excellent Breakfast - not a buffet but plenty of food and the staff were very friendly. We did not eat dinner in the restaurant as meals were pricey - even for Singapore standards.

Reviews.Title: “loved the hotel”
Reviews.Author: blondee2Melbourne
Reviews.Content: good location, about 7 min walk to nearest MRT. hotel itself is lovely, old world feel. room a good size and breakfast great. The breakfast staff are lovely and attentive. 7/11 opposite and a cheap chinese restaurant just around the corner. If you walk out of the hotel and turn left you get a great view of old style buildings, a lovely irish pub and other restaurants. Would def stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “ok”
Reviews.Author: marieanddon
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1 night before cruise. near chinatown area and easy to walk to mer lion. problem was on check in. Were expecting a group and some of the rooms not ready, very poor reception check in. Room was clean and comfortable with double bed and tv. Breakfast was good value.

Reviews.Title: “Tired and Rundown, bad airconditioning. Beware this one!”
Reviews.Author: TassieExpat
Reviews.Content: This is a terrible hotel. We checked in for what was to be a 10 night stay. I became ill because of the airconditioning (strong mould smell in the room which activated a bad asthma attack). I opened the door into the courtyard which was no better so had to try to sleep for the night with an airconditioner that only worked on "roar". We asked to be checked out the next morning because I was so ill. They said did we want another room and I hesitantly said yes if the airconditioning wasn't the same system to be then told there were no rooms. We were charged S$550 for a one night stay (2 nights) and there was absolutely no consideration for the fact that I was ill. We had booked a "Garden Suite" - this was not as described just an L-shaped room full of battered and chipped furniture and very tired decor - wallpaper missing in parts etc.

Reviews.Title: “Dependable, Friendly and Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: chreong
Reviews.Content: It was a normal business trip and as usual booked to stay in Berjaya Hotel Singapore. As usual, staff recognised me upon arrival, as I stayed there a few times already and no hassle check in. The even gave me the same room I've stayed for the last few times. Managed to stay in another hotel New Majestic, for one night during this trip to Singapore. Realised themed boutique hotels are just nice to look at, but when it comes to being comfortable and dependable, nothing beats a good 4 star normal room with all the required facilities. Themed boutique hotels are impressive and have captivating first impression, but not very good for practicality! The room i stayed was designed as all white and bare.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: George0903
Reviews.Content: I booked a long time in advance and was subsequently worried by reports of noise etc.However we were delighted with the room, Could not hear any noise from bars across road. Clean, comfortable bed, good bathroom, great shower, great breakfast.We ate in one evening and had a fabulous meal. All in all a great experience - and they booked stored our bags and booked a taxi to the airport (we paid the taxi driver - no hotel surcharge)

Reviews.Title: “Great value, and location”
Reviews.Author: iandeborah
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a surprise. Nice huge room, paper every morning and a breakfast to die for. Location close to Chinatown, food markets, and 2 MRT stations was better than I anticipated. Staff at the front desk in general were polite, but not as helpful as some we have come across. As our room was at the back, we heard no noise from the bars across the road, but walking down Duxton road at night the noise mentioned by others didn't seem overly bad.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC !!!”
Reviews.Author: AvidTravellers56
Reviews.Content: A Deluxe room inclusive of breakfast for $125 per night was a bargain. We stayed there twice, 4 nights at beginning of December and 3 nights at the beginning of January after extensive travelling. Couldn't have asked for anything more - total value for money. As noted by some other travellers - LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION was the best. It's unfortunate that Lordpink (solo traveller) has allowed $20 to sour her stay at this fabulous establishment. You do have a choice when you get in the taxi - pay a price or ask the driver to turn on the meter...........

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - we will be back to the Berjaya!!”
Reviews.Author: scottandemma1975
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure why there is any negativity to this hotel. Whilst I agree some people may just be unlucky in their experience with all aspects of travel (dont get me started on my flight back!), I honestly feel that the Berjaya rates as one of the most friendly, clean and well located hotels I have stayed in... and I travel worldwide for Business often, so i'm confident I can say what is considered "bad". I stayed for 8 nights at the Berjaya with my girlfriend. Check-in was quick, and a nice touch with complimentary fruit punch from the staff whilst credit card details were logged. We stayed room-only (because we are known to be lazy in the mornings!), although on the one occasion we made breakfast it was both reasonably priced and very good standard of food and service. Good enough to consider the extra room cost next time round! Location was as near to Chinatown as you could hope for. My girlfriend and I enjoy being involved in the culture of places and the Berjaya gave us "Chinatown on your doorstep" with some of the best food I've had and tons of late night market stalls. MRT is the best way to travel and both Chinatown and Tanjong Pagar stations were within 5mins walking distance of the hotel. The bars across the road... yes they are there, but lets put things in perspective. If you dont like to be near a bar and if you want a sterile, high rise, overly priced big chain hotel thats a cab ride from anything then thats your choice... so dont book the Berjaya. Myself and my partner, we actually loved the vibe of the area!! It was vibrant, friendly and we often saw families walking around. It wasnt seedy in the least as I have read and it felt safe. Loads of bars to choose from, and some had an excellent menu for food which we sampled (Road House Grill - try the cheescake desert... heaven!!). Yes it gets noisy... but so does London (and London is not as safe, trust me). We made good relationships with the bar staff of a few places and they always remembered our names and drink order! We'd have drinks on the table when they saw us walking up the road! We had jet lag one night and got up at 1am just to pop over the road for a cold drink and friendly chat with the local bar staff... I think thats what makes a holiday, not a source of complaint. Like I said, we happened to have a dream holiday, which was only helped by the Berjaya's staff, cleanliness and location. I can also accept some people may not share my opinion of the area... but some people are hard to please. You're going on holiday... open your eyes to other peoples cultures and just soak up the atmosphere and enjoy!! If you can do that you'll love the Berjaya as we did!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location pity about the noise”
Reviews.Author: sam63
Reviews.Content: Location is excellent if you want to explore China town. Everything is with in walking distance. We loved this motel has a great atmosphere and the room had everything we needed. The nosie however on a Friday night coming fronm the nightclub across the road was amazing. Our room was directly opposite the nightclub door so everytime the door opened we would be hit with the noise. I am pretty easy going and noise does not usually worry me. We will stay again as we loved this motel's location however we will request a different room.

Reviews.Title: “good one”
Reviews.Author: koolguysg
Reviews.Content: Actually before booking this hotel i had checked out the reviews and it was pretty good and then when i reached the hotel it was really well maintained neat and the staff were vey co-operative, i had booked a junior suite on the 4th floor and it was really good with more space and it had only 1 negative the lift is very slow.... and for party goers no problem u have lots of pub around this area.:)

Reviews.Title: “Nice and comfortable..”
Reviews.Author: DeeGUk
Reviews.Content: Stayed for only 1 night and we got a room which was very clean and well kept. We had no view though but we were not concerned. The room was very quite althoughthe street outside got busy during the night. The staff were very firendly (although not many) which suited us fine. Excellent location - close to china town and small eating centre with Hawker stall style indoor place ! which was perfect for our meals! This location was excellent if you wanted to stay close to china town to savour the different types of food!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but no connection”
Reviews.Author: bareynolds3
Reviews.Content: The location is convenient (two blocks from Chinatown), our rooms (2) were both clean and quiet (we were not on the street side) however as a modern traveler Internet access is a "must have." They charged S$8/15 minutes (which we declined thnking there was an Internet cafe just a few doors away.) Alas the name of the establishement was "Internet Cafe" but they had no internet available. I tried to use the "business center" for online flight confirmation but there was no Internet service for over 24 hours. When we finally got connected and tried to print our boarding passes, the printer was out of paper, and when they put paper in it was out of ink - so no boarding passes. I was a bit surprised to find Malaysia was "more connected" (at least in KL) than Singapore! So if Internet connection is important, the Berjaya Singapore isn't the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “A few paltry $'s more important to Berjaya than honouring deals and customer satisfaction.”
Reviews.Author: lesleyrimington
Reviews.Content: Small boutique location in interesting building in great location on outskirts of China Town. The 2 Garden suites we booked were small and had dim lighting, but had traditional decor and individual charm about them. Garden courtyard nice to look at, but has no practical purpose as small and dark with no seating. We booked via internet and paid deposit, but when our credit card wouldn't scan upon check-in we were asked to pay an excessive deposit which exceeded the total cost of our stay by hundreds of dollars. When we requested the 2 pieces of free laundry and 2 hours free internet access per day "available with all suites" as advertised on Berjaya Hotel website, the staff made every [--] excuse under the sun as to why we could not have this and would have to pay and kept interrupting my breakfast to discuss it. Even after we complained to Manager about misrepresentation and expressed our anger and disappointment, he continued to make excuses and refused to honour the deal or compromise. Unfortunately, this turned what would have been a pleasant stay into a stressful experience and we left the Hotel feeling like just a few paltry dollars was more important to Berjaya then customer satisfaction and repeat business. Unfortunately a letter to Beryaya's head office afforded us no satisfication either, as they merely referred our complaint to the Manager in Singapore we had already had bad dealings with and we had to suffer another round of [--] excuses from him via email. Thus, I am afraid we would not stay there again and could not recommend it, which is a shame really because I work as a travel consultant and my views and experiences on hotel accommodation is often sought by people travelling to Singapore

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel and Service”
Reviews.Author: Jenny6102
Reviews.Content: My husband, 18 year old daughter and I spent a most wonderful and relaxing 7 nights at the Berjaya Hotel in Duxton Rd, Singapore. This unique boutique hotel, located in Chinatown, was originally Shop Houses and was converted to accommodation. We arrived 7am in the morning expecting to be able to store our luggage as the check in time was 2pm. We were advised that the two rooms that we had booked were available for our use immediately. We were most pleasantly surprised! The rooms were fantastic and very large. Our room had a king size bed and our daughter's had twin beds and a large sitting area. The rooms were well presented and kept beautifully cleaned and vacuumed for our entire stay. We were given the option of not having our sheets replaced every day (for environmental reasons) which we took advantage of. The beds and pillows would rate amongst the most comfortable I have slept on in hotel accommodation. Our accommodation included breakfast in the dining area and we were served by the most wonderful wait staff, very attentive and friendly. Breakfast was served at the table and was fruit juice, tea or coffee, cereal and full cooked breakfast (eggs, bacon, sausage, baked beans, tomatoes) plus toast. We took advantage of the free internet access in the lobby area on several mornings - very fast and convenient! The hotel is very close to the Chinatown MRT ( a very enjoyable walk through the markets!) and Maxwells Food Hall ( I can recommend the Fried Kwai Tow). I noted several comments from other people regarding the location. Yes, it is in the nightclub area, but our room overlooked Duxton Rd and was opposite several clubs and the noise at no time disturbed our sleep. They must have quite amazing sound proofing (and our windows were all double glazed) as the only time we heard any sound was when doors opened when people walked in or out of the clubs. We at no time felt threatened or in any danger while walking home late at night. Overall, I am delighted to recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “B&B in Blackpool not four star hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: hunnz
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for one night stay on way to Cambodia. Booked a suite initially on web for our family of four. Couple of days later advised room not available. Re-booked with another web site (two twin rooms) We arrived at hotel and were shown to our rooms. They were very bad indeed. The front wall of our rooms were covered with two inches of perspex plastic (to keep noise out?? -didn't work) They had no charm at all and as remarked above, resembled a B&B in Blackpool. A week later we noticed we had been charged an extra $680 NZ (for the suite) We are in the process of trying to sort this out, but what really upset us was that on checkin at this hotel no one told us about the double booking or even offered us the suite we have been charged for. The hotel has not replied to my husbands email. Please do yourself a favour and stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “A dreadful experience”
Reviews.Author: divetheworldLondon
Reviews.Content: This has to be the worst hotel we have ever stayed in. There was nobody to help us carry our luggage up the steps from the cab and we were given a duplex at the front instead of the Garden Suite we had booked. When my husband complained he was informed there was a broken pipe but no apology was received. A note in the room informed us that the restaurant and bar were unavailable this month (a check of other reviews suggests they have been closed for several months.) Breakfast was disgusting, no choice, tepid and sloppy service. Another guest remarked that the words "Fawlty Towers" came to mind. We booked this hotel as a change of location from our usual choices but it has deteriorated with too many girlie bars, pubs and late night noise. After two days we left to stay at our favourite Singapore hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great if you don't need Sleep”
Reviews.Author: roxipod
Reviews.Content: Only 2 good things: room layout and location. Paid a lot for the room but it was noisy late into the night. Internet was very expensive and breakfast was nothing special. Have stayed in many hotels in Singapore and travel frequently worldwide - would definitely not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Tired and over-rated”
Reviews.Author: PlanC
Reviews.Content: The hotel has not been maintained since its conversion a couple of decades ago. We were surprised to find it opposite a number of clip joints and "buddy" bars which were noisy late into the night. Breakfast was very poor. There are much better hotels in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it!”
Reviews.Author: cello626
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel on line as special treat for my wedding anniversary in the midst of a vacation in SE Asia, predominately in budget accomodation. We were not impressed! Initially were given a room with broken AC. When we asked to move, we were placed in a smaller room that was newly refurbished, but as it turned out not finished (no chain lock on the door, no in-room safe). There was too little staff at night (front desk clerk had to play hotel engineer, bell boy and house keeper) and in the morning the information we recevied was incorrect (housekeeping delievered a room service menu without breakfast choices when we rang asking for this and in response to a request regarding where to get transport to our next itinerary stop we were given information that placed us more than a mile away from where we actually needed to be). The one surprising positive to this hotel are the restaurants right around it. Much is made of the night clubs that are litterally outside the door. Head a few paces out of this area however and you have several award winning eateries on quiet leafy streets with beautifully maintained colonial architecture.

Reviews.Title: “very charming, great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: HK_Expat
Reviews.Content: great location (if you don't mind the bars nearby), very friendly staff, charming colonial decor. i stayed here as a very pregnant, very grumpy person -- and even i couldn't find anything to complain about. if you know pregnant ladies, that's saying something!

Reviews.Title: “What a dump”
Reviews.Author: SukhumvitRoad
Reviews.Content: I was booked here by a company I was visiting because I said I would like to stay in Chinatown for a change. What a mistake. The hotel was so crummy that I had to try three rooms before one was found in which enough things worked to make it habitable. The place is dingy, rundown, dirty, and threadbare. If it has any staff other than one harried guy behind the desk, I never saw any evidence of them. Maintenance is apparently an enitrely unknown concept. Now, to be fair, this hotel would be a perfectly acceptable $20 a night flophouse since, all in all, it has the overall flavor of the kind of hotel that charges by the hour. But note this: their rates are higher than the Regent. They even charge more for slow, almost useless internet service than the Regent charges for adequate broadband access. Don't even think about staying here unless there isn't another room available in all of Singapore. Frankly, I wouldn't suggest you consider it then. Better to head for the airport instead.

Reviews.Title: “Grand old lady of a hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Chaucer
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with my 2 night stay at this charming and elegant hotel that oozed colonial glamour. The staff were exceptionally accommodating and helpful. We arrived very early at 9am and expected to be allowed to leave our bags there and check in later - what a pleasant surprise to be told we could check in straight away, and when I commented that we would need to leave at 4am on Sunday, the gallant hotel clerk invited us to eat breakfast before going to our room, given that we would not be able to take advantage of it on Sunday. Such tremendous care and thoughfulness is much appreciated and rarely found. The hotel room was unexpectedly spacious with lovely antique style colonial furniture. Other reviewers have commented that some aspects of the rooms require attention. It was certainly true that some paintwork was peeling and the wallpaper lifting in some parts, but I think these are relatively minor issues that do not detract from the overall pleasant impression of the room. The musty smell mentioned by some reviewers was slightly noticeable in the stair well, but not in the room or anywhere else in the hotel. The hotel is well situated in China Town and an easy walk (even with luggage) from Tanjong Pagar MRT. Despite the fact that Duxton Rd is a busy place at night with bars, restaurants etc, there was no noise at all in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Good if you need a bed”
Reviews.Author: Belgian_EU
Reviews.Content: I needed a bed in Singapore for one night and this was one of the few hotels with a spare room. Pros: In the centre of Chinatown and very well located for all the gay bars and the nightlife. The room was clean and the wireless internet (not advertised on the hotel website) was a bonus and relatively cheap. The location, surprisingly, was quiet. Cons: This hotel needs a complete overhaul and obviously has not been touched since the early 1990s. In the room I had the carpets were falling apart where the air conditioning had dripped 20 years of water onto them. Hence the smell of mould - mild, but there - that pervaded the entire hotel. All furniture was old and rickety, but serviceable. I paid far too much for this hotel (SGD 205 for a twin room) but it was the best on offer. I wouldn't stay here again unless it was for one night, and I really just needed a bed and a shower.

Reviews.Title: “Simply excellent”
Reviews.Author: hungarianelephant
Reviews.Content: I have nothing but praise for this charming little hotel. The decor harks back to a bygone age, right down to the odd push-button radios in the rooms. After getting there through Singapore's oppressive humidity, this is a delightful experience. The chains could not compare with it. The rooms are comfortable if a little dated. The showers are powerful, and the breakfast is as good as I have had this far from home. But what really stands out about the Berjaya is its service. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff here. If you sat waiting in reception for a couple of minutes, you were offered a drink. The hotel was even able to provide shower facilities after we checked out and before we headed over to the airport. In short - highly recommended to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Probably the best service in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: AdAM0247
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this lovely small hotel in October 2006. After staying in several hotels in the region, the Duxton stood out for its friendly service and attention to detail. A good fairly central location and lots of charm. I would definately recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting place”
Reviews.Author: Mr_Botak
Reviews.Content: This is a quirkly, old style hotel which is interesting, but probably not somewhere to stay for long. The suite room was split over two levels and had a rickety old spiral staircase, the room was big, but not especially clean and everything was well worn. The musty smell was very apparent throughout the hotel. The hotel is situated in Duxton Road which contains endless Karaoke bars, and the noise on Saturday night was quite bad. It is within walking distance of the excellent Maxwell Road food court and Tanjong Pagar MRT. Recommended for those looking for something different.

Reviews.Title: “Worth a visit”
Reviews.Author: Mskins
Reviews.Content: I agree mostly with the 'musty charm' review above, but I will add as follows: On arrival in the rain, a porter came out to the taxi with an umbrella. On check-in, they presented me with a small glass of juice. I was escorted to the room and all was explained to me. It was very quiet. There were mostly families there. I got a peek in the more expensive rooms and they were very very nice. Decor in the lobby was upmarket Decor in the (back) room that I had was pleasant (marble bench tops in the bathroom for example). The street the hotel is in is quite old with the old style Singapore architecture. Most of the houses in the street were night clubs that might have been pink (by some of the names), but did not go in, so cannot confirm. Newspapers were delivered to the room each morning. The restaurant next door was very very good. If you want a pleasant stay away from the chains, this you should consider.
